definition: high official
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
person/employee/member

sentences.english: He supposed one of them announced the visit of the Manchu.
sentences.chinese: 他估量其中有一張是通知那位滿清大員蒞臨的消息。
當然是我們種姓中的大員。

sentences.english: Baltasar the king made a great feast for a thousand of his nobles: and every one drank according to his age.
sentences.chinese: 貝耳沙匝王爲大員千人擺設了盛筵，並與千人宴飲。

definition: to ascend the throne
district magistrate/county magistrate
to be in charge of something specific
to be in overall charge/to oversee
foreign affairs (in Qing times)/foreign learning
carriage
to evaluate the merit of sth
fellow villager
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies

Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
prime minister (in ancient China)
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
